Reason: The configuration option memtable_cleanup_threshold is performance-sensitive. This is because the value of memtable_cleanup_threshold directly impacts the flushing of the largest memtable, which in turn affects the system's write performance. The code snippet provided shows that the cleaningThreshold is used to determine when to trigger the flush of the largest memtable based on the memtableAllocationType. This operation is time-expensive and memory-expensive as it involves managing the size of memtables in the system, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
